properties.name: items

attributes.name: items

properties.description: `true`, when running in a phone.

properties.description: `true`, when running in a touch device.

attributes.description: `true`, when running in a phone.

attributes.description: `true`, when running in a touch device.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Submittable string value. The default value is the trimmed text content of the element.

properties.name: _hasVaadinItemMixin
properties.description:
Used for mixin detection because `instanceof` does not work with mixins.
e.g. in VaadinListMixin it filters items by using the
`element._hasVaadinItemMixin` condition.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: If true, the item is in selected state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: If true, the item is in selected state.

properties.name: _hasVaadinListMixin
properties.description: Used for mixin detection because `instanceof` does not work with mixins.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: The index of the item selected in the items array

properties.name: items
properties.description:
The list of items from which a selection can be made.
It is populated from the elements passed to the light DOM,
and updated dynamically when adding or removing items.

The item elements must implement `Vaadin.ItemMixin`.

Note: unlike `<vaadin-combo-box>`, this property is read-only,
so if you want to provide items by iterating array of data,
you have to use `dom-repeat` and place it to the light DOM.

properties.name: _searchBuf
properties.description: The search buffer for the keyboard selection feature.

methods.name: _scrollToItem
methods.description: Scroll the container to have the next item by the edge of the viewport

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: The index of the item selected in the items array

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description:
Define how items are disposed in the dom.
Possible values are: `horizontal|vertical`.
It also changes navigation keys from left/right to up/down.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description:
The list of items from which a selection can be made.
It is populated from the elements passed to the light DOM,
and updated dynamically when adding or removing items.

The item elements must implement `Vaadin.ItemMixin`.

Note: unlike `<vaadin-combo-box>`, this property is read-only,
so if you want to provide items by iterating array of data,
you have to use `dom-repeat` and place it to the light DOM.

elements.description:
The overlay element.

### Styling

See [`<vaadin-overlay>` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html)
for `<vaadin-context-menu-overlay>` parts.

See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: _last
properties.description: returns true if this is the last one in the opened overlays stack

properties.name: owner
properties.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `owner` The host element of the renderer function.
- `model` The object with the properties related with rendering.

properties.name: template
properties.description: The template of the overlay content.

properties.name: content
properties.description: References the content container after the template is stamped.

properties.name: model
properties.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

properties.name: modeless
properties.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description:
When set to true, the overlay is hidden. This also closes the overlay
immediately in case there is a closing animation in progress.

properties.name: focusTrap
properties.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

properties.name: restoreFocusOnClose
properties.description: Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.

methods.name: _outsideClickListener
methods.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

elements.name: Vaadin.ContextMenuOverlayElement

attributes.description: Owner element passed with renderer function

attributes.name: renderer

Receives three arguments:

attributes.name: template

attributes.name: model
attributes.description: Object with properties that is passed to `renderer` function

attributes.name: modeless
attributes.description:
When true the overlay won't disable the main content, showing
it doesn’t change the functionality of the user interface.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description:
When set to true, the overlay is hidden. This also closes the overlay
immediately in case there is a closing animation in progress.

attributes.name: focus-trap
attributes.description:
When true move focus to the first focusable element in the overlay,
or to the overlay if there are no focusable elements.

attributes.name: restore-focus-on-close

events.name: vaadin-overlay-close
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-close
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-escape-press
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-escape-press
fired before the `vaadin-overlay` will be closed on ESC button press. If canceled the closing of the overlay is canceled as well.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-open
events.description:
vaadin-overlay-open
fired after the `vaadin-overlay` is opened.

events.name: vaadin-overlay-outside-click
events.description:
We need to listen on 'click' / 'tap' event and capture it and close the overlay before
propagating the event to the listener in the button. Otherwise, if the clicked button would call
open(), this would happen: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z86V_ICUCD4

elements.description:
`` is a Web Component for creating context menus. The content of the menu can be populated in three ways: imperatively by using the items API or a renderer callback function and declaratively by using Polymer's Templates. ### Items Items is a higher level convenience API for defining a (hierarchical) menu structure for the component. If a menu item has a non-empty `children` set, a sub-menu with the child items is opened next to the parent menu on mouseover, tap or a right arrow keypress. When an item is selected, `` dispatches an "item-selected" event with the selected item as `event.detail.value` property. ```javascript contextMenu.items = [ {text: 'Menu Item 1', children: [ {text: 'Menu Item 1-1', checked: true}, {text: 'Menu Item 1-2'} ] }, {component: 'hr'}, {text: 'Menu Item 2', children: [ {text: 'Menu Item 2-1'}, {text: 'Menu Item 2-2', disabled: true} ] }, {text: 'Menu Item 3', disabled: true} ]; contextMenu.addEventListener('item-selected', e => { const item = e.detail.value; console.log(`${item.text} selected`); }); ``` **NOTE:** when the `items` array is defined, the renderer or a template cannot be used. ### Rendering The renderer function provides `root`, `contextMenu`, `model` arguments when applicable. Generate DOM content by using `model` object properties if needed, append it to the `root` element and control the state of the host element by accessing `contextMenu`. Before generating new content, the renderer function should check if there is already content in `root` for reusing it. ```html

This paragraph has a context menu.

 ``` ```js const contextMenu = document.querySelector('#contextMenu'); contextMenu.renderer = (root, contextMenu, context) => { let listBox = root.firstElementChild; if (!listBox) { listBox = document.createElement('vaadin-list-box'); root.appendChild(listBox); } let item = listBox.querySelector('vaadin-item'); if (!item) { item = document.createElement('vaadin-item'); listBox.appendChild(item); } item.textContent = 'Content of the selector: ' + context.target.textContent; }; ``` You can access the menu context inside the renderer using `context.target` and `context.detail`. Renderer is called on the opening of the context-menu and each time the related context is updated. DOM generated during the renderer call can be reused in the next renderer call and will be provided with the `root` argument. On first call it will be empty. **NOTE:** when the `renderer` function is defined, the template content is not in use. ### Polymer Templates Alternatively to using the `renderer`, you can populate the menu content using Polymer's Templates: ```html ``` ### “vaadin-contextmenu” Gesture Event `vaadin-contextmenu` is a gesture event (a custom event), which is dispatched after either `contextmenu` and long touch events. This enables support for both mouse and touch environments in a uniform way. `` opens the menu overlay on the `vaadin-contextmenu` event by default. ### Menu Listener By default, the `` element listens for the menu opening event on itself. In order to have a context menu on your content, wrap your content with the `` element, and add a template element with a menu. Example: ```html

This paragraph has the context menu provided in the above template.

Another paragraph with the context menu.

 ``` In case if you do not want to wrap the page content, you can listen for events on an element outside the `` by setting the `listenOn` property: ```html
The element that listens for the context menu.
``` ```javascript const contextMenu = document.querySelector('vaadin-context-menu#customListener'); contextMenu.listenOn = document.querySelector('#menuListener'); ``` ### Filtering Menu Targets By default, the listener element and all its descendants open the context menu. You can filter the menu targets to a smaller set of elements inside the listener element by setting the `selector` property. In the following example, only the elements matching `.has-menu` will open the context menu: ```html

This paragraph opens the context menu

This paragraph does not open the context menu

 ``` ### Menu Context You can bind to the following properties in the menu template: - `target` is the menu opening event target, which is the element that the user has called the context menu for - `detail` is the menu opening event detail In the following example, the menu item text is composed with the contents of the element that opened the menu: ```html
  • Foo
  • Bar
  • Baz
 ``` ### Styling `` uses `` internal themable component as the actual visible context menu overlay. See See [`` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html) for `` parts. See [ThemableMixin – how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki) Note: the `theme` attribute value set on `` is propagated to the internal `` component. In case of using nested menu items, the `theme` attribute is also propagated to internal `vaadin-context-menu-list-box` and `vaadin-context-menu-item`'s.

properties.name: theme
properties.description:
Helper property with theme attribute value facilitating propagation
in shadow DOM. Allows using `theme$="[[theme]]"` in the template.

properties.name: items
selector
properties.description:
CSS selector that can be used to target any child element
of the context menu to listen for `openOn` events.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

properties.name: openOn
properties.description: Event name to listen for opening the context menu.

properties.name: listenOn
properties.description:
The target element that's listened to for context menu opening events.
By default the vaadin-context-menu listens to the target's `vaadin-contextmenu`
events.

properties.name: closeOn
properties.description: Event name to listen for closing the context menu.

properties.name: renderer
properties.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the menu overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `contextMenu` The reference to the `<vaadin-context-menu>` element.
- `context` The object with the menu context, contains:
  - `context.target`  the target of the menu opening event,
  - `context.detail` the menu opening event detail.

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Add the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Remove the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

methods.name: _onOverlayOpened
methods.description: Runs before overlay is fully rendered

methods.name: _onVaadinOverlayOpen
methods.description: Runs after overlay is fully rendered

params.name: e
params.description: used as the context for the menu. Overlay coordinates are taken from this event.

elements.name: Vaadin.ContextMenuElement

selector
attributes.description:
CSS selector that can be used to target any child element
of the context menu to listen for `openOn` events.

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

attributes.name: open-on
attributes.description: Event name to listen for opening the context menu.

attributes.name: listen-on
attributes.description:
The target element that's listened to for context menu opening events.
By default the vaadin-context-menu listens to the target's `vaadin-contextmenu`
events.

attributes.name: close-on
attributes.description: Event name to listen for closing the context menu.

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the content of the menu overlay.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The root container DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `contextMenu` The reference to the `<vaadin-context-menu>` element.
- `context` The object with the menu context, contains:
  - `context.target`  the target of the menu opening event,
  - `context.detail` the menu opening event detail.

events.name: item-selected
events.description: Fired when an item is selected when the context menu is populated using the `items` API.
